CatDescriptText: Cutline for image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper September 2, 1967, pg. 13, reads: "Deputy Mayor on the Spot - While top police 'brass' surrounded Deputy Mayor David Stahl on City-County Building steps, William 'Bouie' Hayden [Haden] (in checkered shirt) and Eugene Taylor, 31, of North Side (in suit) tell Stahl (with back to camera) bluntly and impolitely that the hundreds of Negro youths who surrounded them on 'March to Mayor's Office' don't like Mayor Barr's going to Vietnam before problems of unemployment, housing, recreation and police situation in Pittsburgh are solved. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Crowd gathered around Pittsburgh Deputy Mayor David Stahl, unknown police official, Eugene Taylor, and William "Bouie" Haden, during "March to Mayor's Office"
